kiwi.ui
Class ContentPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  kiwi.ui.KPanel
                      kiwi.ui.ContentPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public abstract class ContentPanel
extends KPanel

This class defines methods common to components that display (and allow the editing of) a piece of data, which is represented by a DomainObject. Typically, the component is filled with editing fields and other input components that correspond to fields in the domain object. Data is synchronized between the domain object and these fields via calls to the methods setData() and syncData().

Author:
Mark Lindner, PING Software Group
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

ContentPanel

public ContentPanel()
Method Detail

ContentPanel

public void ContentPanel()
Construct a new ContentPanel.

setData

public abstract void setData(DomainObject data)
Synchronize a DomainObject with the ContentPanel. Subclassers should define this method to copy the appropriate values from the domain object to the corresponding input elements in the interface. The reference to the domain object must also be saved so that its state may be updated in the syncData() method.

Parameters:
data - The DomainObject to associate with this ContentPanel.

syncData

public abstract boolean syncData()
Synchronize data entered into the ContentPanel with the DomainObject that was provided with the most recent call to setData(). Subclassers should define this method to copy the appropriate values from the input elements in the interface to the corresponding fields in the domain object.

Data validation is performed by a DomainObject's setter methods. Invalid input is flagged by raising a AccessorException, which must be caught by the syncData() method. The message in the exception is a human- readable phrase that describes the problem with the input; this message may be displayed in a warning dialog box to notify the user of the erroneous input.

Returns:
true if no data validation errors occurred, and false otherwise.

setEditable

public abstract void setEditable(boolean editable)
Set the editable property for this ContentPanel. Some interfaces have both an editable (edit) and a non-editable (view) mode, but some subclasses may not implement both; in this case the method will be a no-op.

Parameters:
editable - A flag specifying whether the component will be editable.

activate

public boolean activate()
Activate this content panel. The meaning of activate is context-specific. If this is one of a sequence of panels in a tabbed pane, for example, this method might be called when the user selects the corresponding tab to make this panel visible.

Returns:
A flag specifying whether this panel may be activated. The default implementation returns true.

deactivate

public boolean deactivate()
Deactivate this content panel. The meaning of deactivate is context-specific. If this is one of a sequence of panels in a tabbed pane, for example, this method might be called when the user selects another tab to make this panel invisible.

Returns:
A flag specifying whether this panel may be deactivated. The default implementation returns true.

getTitle

public java.lang.String getTitle()
Get the title for this panel. The usage of this method will vary; if this is one of a sequence of panels in a tabbed pane, for example, this method might return the string that should appear in the tab corresponding to this panel.

Returns:
The title for the panel. The default implementation returns an empty string.
